terms.definition: Application Programming Interface - a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate with each other
Detailed written materials that explain how to use, operate, maintain, or troubleshoot a product, system, or service
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Written materials specifically designed to help end-users understand and effectively use a product or service
Comprehensive documentation that details all available API endpoints, parameters, request/response formats, and usage examples
Documentation designed to allow users to find answers and solve problems independently without contacting support
Large-scale documentation systems designed for businesses to manage internal and external knowledge across multiple products and teams
A lightweight markup language that uses plain text formatting syntax to create structured documents
Frequently Asked Questions - a compilation of common questions and their answers about a product or service
A centralized platform or portal that organizes and provides access to all documentation resources for a product or organization
A basic structural blueprint or layout that shows the arrangement and hierarchy of content in a document or interface
JSON Web Token authentication - a secure method of transmitting information between parties as a digitally signed token
Role-Based Access Control - a security approach that restricts system access based on user roles and permissions
Secure Sockets Layer encryption - a security protocol that creates an encrypted connection between a web server and browser
General Data Protection Regulation compliance - adherence to European privacy laws that govern how personal data is collected, processed, and stored
